title: Premium Easing Curves
description: Easing curves extracted from Linear, Vercel, and other premium software. Use these instead of default CSS easings.

linearStandard.name: Linear Standard
linearStandard.usage: Primary easing for most UI transitions. Feels natural and responsive.

easeOutExpo.name: Ease Out Expo
easeOutExpo.usage: Fast start, gradual stop. Great for enter animations.

easeOutQuint.name: Ease Out Quint
easeOutQuint.usage: Similar to expo but slightly less aggressive.

easeOutBack.name: Ease Out Back
easeOutBack.usage: Overshoots slightly then settles. Use sparingly for emphasis.

easeInExpo.name: Ease In Expo
easeInExpo.usage: Slow start, fast end. Good for exit animations.

chevronEase.name: Chevron/Icon Rotation
chevronEase.usage: Specifically for icon rotations like expand/collapse chevrons.

recommendations.enterVsExit: Exit animations should typically be 75% the duration of enter animations for responsiveness.
recommendations.hoverTransitions: Use 150-160ms for hover states to feel immediate but smooth.
recommendations.modalDialogs: 200ms open, 150ms close is the standard Linear pattern.
recommendations.accessibilty: Always provide instant alternatives for users with reduced motion preference.
